website_summaries.verdict: Made of 50% merino wool, these 6 pairs of tall socks are very comfortable. We love how they can be bought in packs with multiple colors.
pros: These socks get high marks for retaining their shape even after many washes
They’re known for keeping feet warm and dry, regardless of the season or weather
They wick away moisture and don’t retain odors
cons: Many of the colors look different in person than they do online

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great socks, they are keeping my feet warm and the free sandals are a pleasant unexpected extra.
customer_reviews.author: Zml3030

customer_reviews.title: A good sock for the price, thick and wash up well.
customer_reviews.text: When Costco no longer carried their Smartwool clones in Large, I decided to see what Amazon offered. These looked very similar and were value priced. They arrived nicely packaged (good for gift giving). They feel good and thick. The footbed design is slightly different than the Costco ones, but maybe they will hold up better (my Costco ones became thin at the heel and toes). I've attached a photo of the Fun Toes inside and out, so you can compare for yourself. I've washed and air-dryed them and they look like new.
customer_reviews.author: EmptyNester16

customer_reviews.title: Best Wool Socks for the Price
customer_reviews.text: These socks are excellent for normal use. I walk at least a mile in them every day and they've held up after a dozen washes but they're still good to go if you don't mind minor pilling. If you're an avid hiker these won't fit the bill, but if you're just looking for something comfortable, warm, and cheap, then these are the best you can find at this price range. Also, they're excellent for lounging around the house in. Ultra cozy and warm. P.S. These are THICK wool socks. If your boots were tight before, they'll be even tighter now, so plan accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L.

customer_reviews.title: cheap socks got holes in less than 2 months. save your money and a headache
customer_reviews.text: these socks were a waste of money. I had these socks for less than 2 months and got holes on the back of the heels on all 6 socks. Definitely NOT enough material in the right area of the socks or just a cheaper material used altogether. I have a pair of redhead wool socks for 8 years already and they don't have any holes the way these fun toes socks do. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere. i will show you pictures to prove how cheap these socks are. holes in every pair.
customer_reviews.author: ARCH

customer_reviews.title: My toes love FUN TOES!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Durable, not prone to snags and fraying. They're super warm, I've found myself too warm indoors sometimes and notice it's because of the socks. They were comfortable and warm when hiking in 25-50 degree weather, and same for working outside in the cold. I wear wool socks almost everyday during the winter and these ones are my favorites now, even over other more expensive brands. They're just the right thickness that it's almost like wearing slippers.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them: they fall apart very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these for hiking or backpacking. I bought them for my boys for a backpacking trip, 100% of socks ended up with big holes worn in them within less than 40 miles. Every single sock fell apart. These are crap made in China. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.author: scout3801

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from these socks as they were fairly inexpensive. It I have to admit that they are really warm and super corfortable. Not too that that I can still wear inside of my tennis shoes but still warm enough while sitting out in the woods hunting all day. I will be buying more
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Only Work Socks Husband Wants
customer_reviews.text: My hubby works hard in work boots all day and has tried all the D...Tough Vermont wool socks and People wool socks. These are his favorite. They are a bit softer than the others and not as restrictive/tight. But they don't fatigue and bunch either. These do a great job keeping his feet cushioned and reasonably cool. Eventually the stress points of the heel will wear out, but that's to be expected from hard labor. I buy maybe two packs a year to keep him going and consider it a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are fantastic. I normally wear my shoes all the time - but not anymore. These are far more comfortable, they keep my feet warm with out making them sweat and the thick soles are great. I am replacing all of my socks with these. Well worth the money. Best thing I can say is BUY them!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold!! Comfortable. Don't stink. Warm and dry. Great price. Word to your mother.
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy Stance socks because they have some awesome graphics but they don't keep my feet warm and my feet sweat and stink in them. I bought these socks for hunting and hiking but been wearing them to work and I'm comfortable all day in these things!! And the bonus is that when I get home and take my shoes off I'm not blasted with horrendous foot odor!!! I made a 2nd order as soon as I realized that these socks are amazing. I will never buy cotton socks again. The price is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch72

customer_reviews.title: Not really
customer_reviews.text: Socks seem cheaply made. Very thin, the seam by your toes does not fit well, you need to position it above or below you foot. This is hard to do while slipping your foot into a work boot, likely a nice place for a blister or abrasion. The left one is a "people sock" much better fit and finish. The right is the "fun toe".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They Hold Up Really Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks in January of 2018. In two more months I'll have had them for two years, and not a single pair has worn through. The elastic is still strong, and really, nothing about the socks suggests they're going to give up any time soon. The socks are comfortable and reasonably warm. My only complaint is that my feet tend to sweat in them, and then my feet will get a little cold because of that. I'm not some kind of sock aficionado, so if that's normal, ignore the complaint. I'd buy again...assuming they ever wear out.
customer_reviews.author: onipar

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: My husband works for a exploration drilling company and is out in the elements for 12 hour shifts. Needless to say, his feet get smelly in the summer and cold and smelly in the winter. Since buying these his feet don't stink half as bad after work, they are comfy and he's completely addicted!! I've bought quite a few pair for him now, "Hunnie can you buy me more 'happy feet' socks please?" Has now become a thing in our house. I always correct him and tell him the brand is fun toes but he just says, "these socks make my feet happy so they are happy feet socks!" Haha. Great product, highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: STINK
customer_reviews.text: Received socks that smelled like diesel. Actually the reeked of a diesel smell. All of the socks were like this. Had taken the socks out of the package prior to noticing the smell. To return to much of a hassle. The package that the socks came in was not damaged so it was the socks themselves that smelled so bad. Soaked them in vinegar and water for 3 days then washed. Back soaking as the smell did not come out. I can use them for outside rags. Would NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DonMac

customer_reviews.title: Good for my feet.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are pretty thick but light weight. I like them because they go on and off my feet very easily and are odor free. I am T1D and over 60yr with neuropathy in my lower extremities and I have to have a sock that keeps my feet warm in the winter yet cool in the summer.. These socks are the best I've found for me. I wear them every day, winter, spring, summer and fall they last about 5-6 months which is ok for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: True Life Savers
customer_reviews.text: I run and walk dogs in the Midwest winters. Slush and snow splashes onto my running shoes and soaks through. I used to change out Nike Elite socks a couple times a day, but now these babies do the job all day long. They're the perfect thickness for being active. True 3-weather socks that dry FAST and keep your foot comfortable. They absolutely have an odor. I wouldn't say they produce stinky feet, but if you sweat you smell it when you take your shoes off. I highly recommend these, and I'll be back to buy more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: He insists on wearing wool socks year round and these are the best I have found
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these socks. He insists on wearing wool socks year round and these are the best I have found. I particularly like them because they go through the washer and dryer and don't shrink. For years I have hung his wool socks on the line because they wouldn't hold up to the dryer. No more. He likes them because they are thick and long wearing. As long as these are available I will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Thick, scratchy, and hot - not a year round boot sock for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted merino wool socks comparable to smart wool, but for a more reasonable price. The product description sounded promising. These socks are thicker than expected, scratchy, and hot in boots - unlike Smartwool PhD socks, which are not scratchy and, while warm, don’t make my feet sweat in year round wear. I’m comparatively disappointed. Still, it’s a warm wool sock at six for the price of one smartwool sock, and for cold days will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: DrDWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. These don't feel, wear, or last like true Merino Wool Socks. I have worn other (real) Merino wool socks for many years and thought I would give these a chance considering I was getting 6 pairs for the price I typically pay for 1 pair. Crap. Absolutely not the same quality and should not be labeled as Merino Wool. Wish I had thought to return them but I've missed my return window. At this point, I feel badly for the homeless person that gets them from the donation bin
customer_reviews.author: Wayne S.

customer_reviews.title: They Are $4 Socks and No More - Don’t Kid Yourself
customer_reviews.text: I’m dumb. I honestly thought I was going to get something close to my $18 SmartWools. Not at all. They feel cheap. They’re itchy. There’s a lack of material. “Of course! They’re $4 a pair dummy!” Yeah yeah. I know. Ugh. But the reviews were so good that I hoped... The reviews are optimistic. If SmartWools are 5 stars then these are 2.5 at best. As long as you have realistic expectations, you’re fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: They wear out too easy
customer_reviews.text: I wore these socks daily as my job got cold in the winter. I wore holes in these socks very fast. The entire pack didn't last the winter. I bought a pack of these the year before and while where wore holes quickly they actually lasted me longer (which I still thought was short). So if you are okay with only getting one 3 month season out of these then they are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Great socks, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great socks! I’ve ordered quite a few of the 6-packs at this point. They are soft and comfortable and warm. One thing I like most about these socks is that they DO NOT make my feet sweat (at least not any more than my feet usually do). My feet get hot quite easily and I was curious to see if these socks would add to that issue; I was pleasantly surprised to learn that they don’t make my feet feel like they’re on fire. Also, I wear these socks while hiking and also while I’m working (construction/carpentry) and they fit well with my hiking boots and my work boots. Great socks! I’ll definitely buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: I love these...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted socks to wear in bed when my toes are cold. I wanted them thick enough to warm up cold toes and comfy enough to slip on and off while half asleep. These are so perfect! My feet sometimes get so cold I have to get up and soak them in hot water to get them warm (it’s some kind of medical thing), but these make it so I don’t have to. Strangely, they don’t get overly hot either, so I can fall asleep and stay comfy. I just really love these!
customer_reviews.author: Ska

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, warm & Dry!
customer_reviews.text: Wear these every day at the range in Florida and they cushion my feet, keep my feet dry and don't smell at the end of the day. The anti-bacterial properties are a huge plus for me. Just got back from 8 days in Iceland in town, on the glaciers, through the ice fields and frozen black beaches and only used a single pair of socks in my Merrell boots...FunToes! Everybody else was freezing but my tootsies were toasty! Can't believe they work in Florida heat and Artic chill equally well! Thank you FunToes!
customer_reviews.author: George N, Cahill III

customer_reviews.title: Polyester Wool Blend!!
customer_reviews.text: I got these and was disappointed to see that they’re not made of wool. They’re a polyester wool blend. They don’t mention that anywhere in the description. They aren’t itchy but I got a rash after a couple of weeks of wearing them. Not sure if it’s because I’m allergic to the polyester and other materials they used or because the socks don’t breathe well but overall not nearly as good as the wool socks I was replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They seem like good socks
customer_reviews.text: But they didn't work for me. I found them somewhat itchy and they did not feel or look like any of the other 5+ brands of Merino Wool socks I've bought in the past. They do look like they are good quality and well packaged so you may want to give them a try, everyone is different.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Medugno

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm - Great Wool Socks
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan and wear these socks in my work boots in the winter time. Have also purchased these for my employees who are happy with them as well. Nice, warm, comfortable, durable, wool socks that I've been wearing for a couple years and have the same dozen pairs I originally ordered with no holes. They seem to hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and initially quality but no longevity
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several packs over the years. Nice fit and solid initial quality. However they do not last a long time. Even with only air drying, I get about a year out of them and they wear out several different ways. Holes, tears, and sometimes thinning completely out. The price and initial quality keep me coming back
customer_reviews.author: Bee410

customer_reviews.title: Cheap good winter socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because they were cheap and apparently had good reviews and indeed they are very warm, they hold up washing and yes they let a lot of lint on the washer and other clothes but even like that I think they are a very good deal, I guess if I have wash them several times they will loose it, recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Salazar Fidel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet cozy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these socks. I bought these initially when we were going to Europe and I wanted some warm socks that would dry quickly when washed. They certainly fit the bill. My husband really likes them. Alas, they are too big for me to wear with shoes, but I love to wear them when relaxing in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Fulkerson

customer_reviews.title: Greatest of socks for in and out of daily weather.
customer_reviews.text: These socks have wool in them for warmth; though, they do not itch like normally wool would. They are very warm, keeps feet dry, not swetty. My husband works for an Airline. We were looking for socks that he could go from indoors to outdoors and not need to take his shies on and off because , of his feet going from warm to cold all day long. He sings these socks praises.,
customer_reviews.author: Nonny

customer_reviews.title: Delivery response time was excellent. One pair of socks has been worn one ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery response time was excellent. One pair of socks has been worn one full day in a pair of hiking boots I am breaking in. No blisters! Actually very comfortable. Workmanship and materials appear to pass initial muster.Any comments on durability will have to wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boot socks
customer_reviews.text: These are boot socks. They're far too thick to wear for anything other than barn boots and maybe over-sized hiking boots. I have 1 pair of wool socks from REI and, ignorantly, I thought these would be somewhat similar but they're not even in the same county. I won't be buying more; these 6 will last me forever.
customer_reviews.author: Meandering Minstrel

customer_reviews.title: Decent value, not high quality material
customer_reviews.text: Warm, decent value, 50% wool socks. The materials are not ideal and that's where the lower price comes from. The acrylic and wool blend leads to a crinkly and slippery feel, and being puffy these socks have an odd feel when stepping. The textile is strange, it seems like there are loops of wool on an acrylic base and the final product is not a typical wool sock. They're too puffy and I think are causing more foot sweat than a typical wool sock.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Warm, durable, and moisture-wicking.
customer_reviews.text: This are wonderfully warm, and they seem to handle moisture well too! I've been biking in my tennis shoes with them through this particularly brutal Chicago winter and they hold up well. I've also been sliding around my house in them and the soles seem to be holding up pretty well, too. Great work!
customer_reviews.author: Kael Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Holes
customer_reviews.text: Socks had a comfortable fit for the first 2-3 weeks. I could feel the material start to thin at the bottoms after a few wears and wash. Some pairs developed holes after a couple weeks and in the following couple months each pair got a hole somewhere in the bottom ball area. Would not recommend these socks to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike204

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Pack
customer_reviews.text: Quality boot sock for cooler weather. My wife and I wore these on a long hunting trip and they wore great. Two days of hard hiking ended with warm dry feet and zero blisters. Also a great value priced pack.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: ... really likes these socks & says how soft & comfortable they are on the inside
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes these socks & says how soft & comfortable they are on the inside. Merino wool is wonderful ! Only been a couple of weeks ... so we'll see how well they hold up (no matter which brand, or how expensive, his socks usually have holes within 4 - 6 months). Will re-post on how well they last.
customer_reviews.author: A. F.

customer_reviews.title: slightly thicker than the Kirkland versions but surprisingly cool worn in sandals
customer_reviews.text: Socks are Merino Wool as advertised, slightly thicker than the Kirkland versions but surprisingly cool worn in sandals. Unlike non-merino wools, I do not notice any skin issues from short fibers, the socks fit well and colors are present by rather subdued and are woven in.
customer_reviews.author: F. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: One of the most comfortable socks I own
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed that these socks were as well made and sturdy for the price. I typically purchase hiking socks from the major manufacturers for their quality and durability. But I have to state these socks approach their high quality at a 1/4 of the cost. I plan to purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdawg

customer_reviews.title: Great cold barrier
customer_reviews.text: These thick yet soft socks are soft were used as a boot lining in the frigid climate of the Arctic Circle of Finland in December. They hugged the foot but weren’t tight at all. I forget they were even on. They’re super warm and does the job to protect feet from air and cold. My boots also had a shearling lining but no way could I use the boot alone or with ordinary socks.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingAround

customer_reviews.title: Love these fluffy socks
customer_reviews.text: These are much cheaper than the Redwing version which are great socks but these are good enough at being socks. If I had the money i would buy Redwing but I am poor so I get Fun Toes! But it has a cool name and my girls always point it out and say Fun Toes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Twinrivergirls

customer_reviews.title: 6 PAIRS. GOOD PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I WEAR SIZE 8 1/2 AND WAS AFRAID THAT THESE WOULD BE TOO BIG BUT THEY FIT PERFECT. I WOULD SEE SOMEONE WITH A 12 NOT BEING ABLE TO GET THEM ON. I WAS DELIGHTFULLY SURPRISED TO LEARN THAT IT CAM WITH 6 PAIRS. IT SEEMED LIKE ONLY 3 PAIR IN THE PHOTO. THEY FIT GREAT AND MY FEET ARE ALREADY TOASTY.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D

customer_reviews.title: I think socks run large
customer_reviews.text: I don't find these socks to be particularly comfortable. I have a size 9 foot and these are the ones recommended for size 8 and up BUT they seem too large to me. I have attempted to shrink them by washing and throwing into a hot dryer but they still are larger then other socks that have the same size rating.
customer_reviews.author: silverhorse

customer_reviews.title: Value pack?  More like VARIETY pack... and certainly not good value.
customer_reviews.text: Fun Toes? FUN toes? These socks are terrible... First of all, a whole variety of mismatched sizes showed up in this "value pack." More like a VARIETY pack! I'm talking major differences in sock widths and lengths in each bag. They are incredibly itchy and low-quality feeling... despite being washed multiple times. And after wearing only one time they are already starting to fray. A part of me wonders if someone working at the plant just decided to play a joke on the customer?? I am actually going back to my old socks (with multiple holes in them) until I can find a suitable replacement. Probably will go back to REI... THEIR merino wool socks are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Love these socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks have worn well and are nice and warm. They have enough stretch to mold to my foot and stay up without hurting my large ankles. I think I would call them medium weight rather than light weight. They fit my athletic shoes but not dressier shoes.
customer_reviews.author: NancyT2U

customer_reviews.title: These are the most comfortable socks I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable socks I have ever owned! They are super soft inside and warm and cozy. I thought they might shrink in the dryer so I sized up to a men's medium. I usually wear a womens large sock. Well, they didn't shrink and now my husband is always wearing my favorite socks. We both love them so I'm going to get more. I think I'll see if I can get them in my size next time so I actually get to keep them. :-)
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for work and motorcycling
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a couple years now. This was my 2nd purchase. Great for wearing with my motorcycle boots as well as work boots around the farm. If they are washed properly, they do a great job. As with most wool socks I've tried, they do wear out faster compared to regular tube socks.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W.

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that's good about these socks is that they do keep my feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are definitely not what I was expecting. They are indeed warm, but they are definitely not odorless and they are not breathable. I have Smart Wool socks that are much more breathable, moisture wicking, and better at keeping odor away than these socks. The one thing they have going for them is warmth, but aside from that, I'd definitely pay extra for Smart Wool or Darn Tough. I wore them with Timbs, leather sneakers, and Shadow Tubulars, and both times they ended up smelling like booty and feeling just as moist as cotton socks. Would not recommend, unless for indoor use only, which is the only time I wear them now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Get them
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing. They are very thick and warm and will last a long time. No holes after months of wearing them. All I know is that for those people who get holes with these socks they must be wearing shoes one size too small. I wear these with well sized boots with room to wiggles my toes a little and they have lasted better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: It's a year and half later, and more than half of the pairs have massive holes. They make your feet sweat. I wasn't doing particularly "hard" walking or work in them either, just normal walking. Just generally cheap, much in spite of the good reviews. I've had Wal-mart socks last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Naime Penn

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different several other nice all wool socks from amazon and all of them ended up with a hole in the back above the heels. I have tried the Costco socks and they are pretty good but they tend to shrink and get tight after several washings. These socks are Just right, they last and don't shrink! I wear a freshly washed pair every day in my hiking/work boots and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Art Gorden

customer_reviews.title: No more searching for a matching pair!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great batch of socks to get you through the winter. It's a mid-weight sock that provides plenty of warmth for cold feet. The construction seems solid, far better than what you'd expect at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Zander

customer_reviews.title: Nice and squishy and they stay that way for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Better cheaper option to that popular brand, you get 6 for the price of 1! My man is on his feet all day, hard labor and loves these with his work boots, and I should mention he does not have top of the line boots, he saves having to do that by getting these socks. I bought him new ones but not because they wore out, but because the sock monster gets them first, that's saying a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Casandra Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: These socks are not bad at all, I usually go with people socks but these were a great price, I realized why they were cheaper after I purchased them. They have a lower Merino Wool percentage. They feel a bit slippery in the shoe compared to people socks
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for winter
customer_reviews.text: These socks are a great price for the quality and how many you get. They are extremely comfortable and warm. My wife even takes them from me! I bought them last year as well. The only thing I will say is that we wore them so much last winter that it wore out the ball of the foot area on the socks, therefore we purchased more this year.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Not the absolute softest merino sock, but an excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat the price for these socks. They are warm and comfortable, and (so far) holding up well. I have large feet, and they're not too tight. I've had merino socks where the inside of the sock was somewhat softer, but those were much more expensive than these (2 - 3x more expensive!)
customer_reviews.author: Jasmol

customer_reviews.title: Great wool socks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my diabetic husband to sleep in. I had looked at some Merino wool socks that were $16 a pop then I found these! I figured if they felt bad on his feet I'd give away or trash. But these socks are amazing! Super soft and he loves them. We do handwash and hang to dry as per instructions. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: They are like the Kirkland brand but come up higher on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why you would ever buy Smartwool or those other brands that are $20 per pair when you can get these for a fraction of the cost. They are like the Kirkland brand but come up higher on the calf. I am a size 8 and they are a bit large for me, but I washed and dried them in the dryer and they shrank a bit for a better fit (they recommend that you air dry them to avoid the shrinkage).
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Maggert

customer_reviews.title: Great socks. I'd ordered some others here and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. I'd ordered some others here and they were NOT good. But these came quickly and are really nice. I hate cold feet and in the winter here in Michigan, they get cold a lot. I hadn't really gotten into wool socks, but decided I needed to. These had the right price and I got six pairs all at once. 50% wool it says and I believe it. Nice and warm and they fit me (size 12 shoe) great. Get 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome socks !
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit well. They are very comfortable and keep my feet warm and dry while working in the cold weather. I have ordered several pair of these socks. They are reasonably price and are well made. I hope they wear well because they sure are comfortable. Thank you for making a great sock at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Best socks ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought 12 more pairs of these after I got the first six. Super comfortable. Hard to differentiate colors after a few washes so they're mostly gray with black looking. Wear them every day in winter - wondering how they'll feel in summer. Not itchy at all!
customer_reviews.author: frtefeteg

customer_reviews.title: I like em
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these for a couple years now. Work construction, they are great value and quality. Last pretty well for how much I abuse them, very comfortable in all seasons. I like this brand of socks, good value compared to most wool socks blends
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Socks Ever Worn
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing hard toe safety boots 40 hours a week for 25+ years. I also walk 3300 stairs for fitness outdoors a few times a week. Best socks I've ever had. Thick cushion in the areas needed most. Have made a huge difference in my foot comfort during and after being on my feet. Have worn in 90 degree August outdoor heat and no difference over less comfortable name brand socks that I've worn over the years. By far best socks I've ever worn and at a reasonable price compared to other similar socks I've seen advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of lint, very thin.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are too cheap for me. They leave a lot of lint on all my clothes in the laundry. There much thinner than I had hoped. Very loose weave terry cloth. Rough texture. This was a waste of money for me but they might work ok for someone else. At least they appear to be cotton-free.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Makes being on your feet all-day Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these to anyone that is constantly on their feet all day. Some people may think 'WOOL', they must be hot. Not so! They are a thicker sock and maybe a snug-fit for some people depending on shoe size. But I recommend you try them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Over a year strong!
customer_reviews.text: Wear these with my work boots everyday at work. Only buying more pairs because the other brand wool socks are much past their retire date. These after a year, still fit tight over my feet and are just as soft/thick. Other brand is thin and pilled badly. These even survived a dog! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these in the past and they have been awesome. Still have the original ones in my daily cycle. However the new ones seem too have worn out very fast. The heels have all ripped but the old ones are still going. Will not buy again and fork up a little more for better ones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice feet warmers
customer_reviews.text: I know these are supposed to be for hiking or whatever, but I use to walk around the house with. My heat is on but my house is still a bit chilly. Once I put these on I feel a noticeable temperature change with my feet feeling warmer. Now these won’t keep your feet super warm, but it takes some of the chill off of them, and they’re super comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Rendezvous

customer_reviews.title: Warm, thick socks
customer_reviews.text: Be aware: these socks are thick to the extent that your shoes may not fit comfortably when wearing them. I can only wear these socks with certain loose fitting shoes, otherwise the shoes are uncomfortably tight (even after loosening the laces).
customer_reviews.author: blankpage

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These sock are a miracle. My boyfriend had sweaty, sore feet all the time. I thought that maybe wool would help. These socks were a God send for him. His feet are now comfortable, the socks are nice and thick and have a good cushion to them. I'd buy them again in a heart beat. Went through the washer and dryer fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Treat for your feet!
customer_reviews.text: Best socks I have ever owned. Super comfortable inner fleece. I wash them in hot with almost no shrinking. I have made multiple purchases of these dating back to when they were called "people socks". Only socks I will ever buy. It would be nice if they came in black. If I need to dress formal I wear these underneath black socks.
customer_reviews.author: Lewie

customer_reviews.title: Soft, durable, warm socks!!!
customer_reviews.text: They smell weird when they first arrived. They’re comfortable and keep your feet nice and toasty. I wouldn’t wear them with regular dress shoes or tennis shoes since you might struggle to put on your shoes since they are thick. I only wear these with my boots and at home. They survived an entire winter of hard work and hikes. Stocking on more since it’s going to be a cold and snowy winter.
customer_reviews.author: Meme Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Brown socks giving off powerful chemical odor
customer_reviews.text: This is for the brown socks. They came with an absolutely overpowering chemical odor. I am washing them in hopes of getting rid of it. If it doesn't, they are going back (possibly in hazmat packaging - it is that bad). Blue ones didn't have the same odor. May adjust my rating if washing gets rid of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: johnoe

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second batch of Fun Toes socks, they are an absolute bargain and love the way they fit. Unlike some other merino I own, they have lots of stretch so are easy to put on. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: I thought the description was too vague. I need ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought the description was too vague. I need thin wool socks. These are very thick. I will need to buy bigger shoes to wear them. Because of this I don’t know how warm they are. Also the top ribbing of the socks are tight. They cut off my circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - don't last
customer_reviews.text: My socks lasted all of 2-3 wearings before they literally fell apart in several places. I would avoid buying these socks. I tried to find the manufacturer on line to complain directly to them and they stay hidden. Given the quality of their product I guess that makes sense. If I could give them a zero star rating that is what I would do.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Todd Miner

customer_reviews.title: Warm but wet, so then cold
customer_reviews.text: Feet get hot in these quick and sweat which leads to them being cold and wet in the long run... Kinda counter productive I think. Unless it's cold cold, don't wear them, but they don't breathe well and they don't do well in the cold after feet warm up because of that.
customer_reviews.author: TreePro Jason Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Going onto our third winter with these. Still no holes despite wearing in work boots most cold days. Very warm. Great thickness with good weave making them very comfortable! Love these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holes in the heel
customer_reviews.text: My son was given these socks for Christmas. The first problem was a hole in the heel of 1 pair 3 weeks later. Now here we are, just over a month and we have had to throw out 5 socks. This product was waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Blakeman

customer_reviews.title: Great socks while they last, but
customer_reviews.text: They don't seem to last long. The bottom wears out after a few months of wear, leaving no padding at all. I think if the bottom had more cushioning, the wool wouldn't wear out and make them so uncomfortable after they begin to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Fortino

customer_reviews.title: Warm, no smell
customer_reviews.text: I'm incredibly happy with these. They're very soft, don't smell after a long day in boots, and keep my feet warm. They're a bit longer than I need for casual use, but I imagine the length is perfect for things like snow sports, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Callister

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy-probably not warm weather socks
customer_reviews.text: I like wool socks for hiking, but they can't be too thick if I'm hiking in warm weather. These are perfect for Spring, fall, and winter, but I don't think they will be very comfortable in the summertime. The packaging even references that they are 3 season socks. They feel great on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wyant

customer_reviews.title: No sweat, no odor
customer_reviews.text: Great product, reasonable price. A little hot for florida but the fact that they completely eliminate foot odor is amazing, and even though they are hot, no wet feet from sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it stays pretty cold in the winter months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband! He loves them. He works in a wearhouse, and it stays pretty cold in the winter months... he wears these socks with both boots and sneakers, they fit comfortably and keep his feet dry and warm all day. So far, they hold up great! He is forever losing stitching or wearing a hole in his socks.. and so far these are very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Dry feet, less odor
customer_reviews.text: So I like to use these during workouts and work since it keeps my feet from being a sweaty stinky mess afterwards. I wish these came in shorter sizes though. Not very aesthetic with shorts on.
customer_reviews.author: Jason is here

customer_reviews.title: nice warm socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are warm without being huge and bulky. I love them for winter. Absolutely not for summer or warm spaces. They really make a difference compared to cotton if you're outside in the cold or in a drafty space.
customer_reviews.author: claycodc

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Great socks, fit well and feel amazing. Far superior to cotton. I also like how they didn't use 100% wool, instead they use a blend. In my opinion this makes for a better sock. Can't wait to use these on my next hiking adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Eximius

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I love wool. Its great for your feet. wool socks breathe, keep your feet warm and dry and unless your allergic to wool should help protect your feet from abrasions etc
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie S.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. Not too puffy not too slim
customer_reviews.text: These fit me, women's size 8, my teens and hubby size 10. These cuddle your feet. They give adequate warmth. They are a puffy sock but definitely not as bulky as other wool socks. Might be a tad tight for sneakers but doable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Preformance
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing! This was my first time skiing and they kept me dry and warm for two whole days without a single issue! The first day of skiing the temps were in the 20s and we had a foot of snow dumped on us. One pair of these socks is all I wore in my boots and my feet were sweating. The socks did their job though and kept the moisture wicked away from my feet so they didnt get cold. I don't have any complaints about this product!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for ski socks and riding socks for colder days. Great price. Wicking and they keep your feet warm and dry. They wash up really well and they dont pill. Great socks. They are really reasonable for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: MB121

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable. Took these bad boys to Peru to conquer ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable. Took these bad boys to Peru to conquer the Salkantay trail to Machu Picchu, and they held up great. Not too hot during the portions in the rainforest but at night when camping at 14,000 feet they kept my toes and feet nice and toasty. We hiked around 15 miles a day for 6 straight days and not a single blister. Can't beat these merino wool socks for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband because he’s always complaining about his feet being cold. After receiving the socks he immediately put them on. He absolutely loves them and now won’t wear any other sock when it’s cold. He says they are so toasty warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Barber

customer_reviews.title: Warm feet
customer_reviews.text: Spent some time in the Alps and these socks kept my feet very warm. They are very comfortable, and do not itch. That is due to the lining, which is soft. Also great for just wearing around the cabin as it was still a little chilly. My wife ended up using them as well, her feet are much smaller but they worked!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Manti

customer_reviews.title: Washing  correctly
customer_reviews.text: Wear well so far and wash good, cool water turned inside out gentle cycle, low heat dryer. I really like these socks. I usually wear cotton ones but these are much more comfortable, so I'll post more later on how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Gough

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Survived ten hours straight of intense use--intense for me anyway. Six hours climbing (about 1,000 m vertical gain), another four hours coming back down. Not only that, but as soon as the socks came off, it felt like all the sweat came off with them. Anyway, they're now my favorite socks. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Prickly and cheap feeling. I think these are a high plastic content and not real merino wool.
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review. Over time these became even more prickly and coarse. Unlike my other merino wool socks from another company sold on amazon these were thrown away after a few uses and washes.
customer_reviews.author: brent t.

customer_reviews.title: I've been looking for the perfect fit warm wool socks for my husband who works ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for the perfect fit warm wool socks for my husband who works outside. This was my second purchase of this product my husband absolutely love them even bought a set for a friend would recommend these to anyone work it inside or outside but particularly anyone who works outside keep your feet nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jimerson3

customer_reviews.title: As good or better than smartwools Fun Toes are good
customer_reviews.text: As good or better than smartwools Fun Toes are good. Wear as slippers in house and with uninsulated footwear down to 18 degrees F
customer_reviews.author: You Killed My Master

product_meta.title: FUN TOES Men's Crew Merino Wool Socks 6 Pairs Winter Lightweight, Reinforced Size 8-12
feature_bullets: STRONG SUPPORT FOR YOUR FEET Reinforced toe makes our men work socks strong enough to last through hundreds of wears; Arch support in the men wool socks keeps your feet comfortable all day

THE PERFECT WEIGHT FOR WINTER Our winter socks for men are made from MERINO WOOL 50% , NYLON 40%, POLYESTER 9% & SPANDEX 1%; The wool socks will keep you feeling warm on the coldest of days, but the socks are still lightweight and stretchy for a comfy fit for sizes 8 to 12
NO ITCHING, NO ODORS Unlike other merino wool socks, our hiking socks have a soft feel that won't leave your feet sweaty and itchy; They also have odor-fighting properties to keep your feet fresh
SO EASY TO LAUNDER The socks in this men socks pack are simple to care for! Just turn the mens warm socks inside out and wash in cold water and then allow them to air dry!
STOCK UP & SAVE Get six pairs of men socks for an amazing price, 4 different colors AS PICTURED this socks are not solid colors. Choose from: Brown, Black, Green and Blue
